definitions.definition: The act of chewing; mastication with the mouth.
definitions.example: I popped the gum into my mouth and gave it a chew.

definitions.definition: A small sweet, such as a taffy, that is eaten by chewing.
definitions.example: Phillip purchased a bag of licorice chews at the drugstore.
The school had banned chew and smokes from the school grounds, even for adults.

definitions.definition: A plug or wad of chewing tobacco; chaw or a chaw.
definitions.example: The ballplayers sat on the bench watching the rain, glumly working their chews.

definitions.definition: The condition of something being torn or ground up mechanically.
To crush with the teeth by repeated closing and opening of the jaws; done to food to soften it and break it down by the action of saliva before it is swallowed.
definitions.example: Make sure to chew thoroughly, and don't talk with your mouth full!

definitions.definition: To grind, tear, or otherwise degrade or demolish something with teeth or as with teeth.
definitions.example: He keeps his feed in steel drums to prevent the mice from chewing holes in the feed-sacks.

definitions.definition: To think about something; to ponder; to chew over.
definitions.example: The professor stood at the blackboard, chalk in hand, and chewed the question the student had asked.
